New Records: Finn Allen equalled the world record set by Hazratullah Zazai of Afghanistan of 16 sixes in a T20I innings.
Finn Allen posted the highest score by a New Zealander in T20Is, beating Brendon McCullum's 123.
Key Match Events: Finn Allen blasted 16 sixes in an innings of 137 from 62 balls.
New Zealand beat Pakistan by 45 runs in the third T20I.
New Zealand made 224-7 after being sent in by Pakistan.
Pakistan was held to 179-7 in their run chase.
Babar Azam scored his third consecutive half-century of the series, making 58 runs.
Post-Match Reflections: Finn Allen commented on his performance, emphasizing his focus on having a solid foundation and playing good cricket shots.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Two of Finn Allen's sixes carried more than 100 meters.
Three of Allen's sixes were hit so far out of the ground that the ball could not be found and had to be replaced.
Allen took a particular toll on Haris Rauf, who conceded 28 runs and 23 runs from his next two overs after giving only two runs in his first over.
Pakistan has now won only one of its last eight T20 internationals as it heads towards this year's World Cup in the United States and Caribbean.
